org.apache.distributedlog.api

Interface AsyncLogWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsyncAbortable, AsyncCloseable

    @InterfaceAudience.Public
 @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public interface AsyncLogWriter
extends AsyncCloseable, AsyncAbortable

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.distributedlog.io.AsyncCloseable

        CLOSE_FUNC, CLOSE_FUNC_IGNORE_ERRORS, NULL

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.distributedlog.io.AsyncAbortable

        ABORT_FUNC, NULL

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Get the last committed transaction id.
      String getStreamName()
      Get the name of the stream this writer writes data to

    • Method Detail

      • getLastTxId

        long getLastTxId()
        Get the last committed transaction id.
        Returns:
        last committed transaction id.

      • write

        CompletableFuture<DLSN> write(LogRecord record)
        Write a log record to the stream.
        Parameters:
        record - single log record
        Returns:
        A Future which contains a DLSN if the record was successfully written or an exception if the write fails

      • writeBulk

        CompletableFuture<List<CompletableFuture<DLSN>>> writeBulk(List<LogRecord> record)
        Write log records to the stream in bulk. Each future in the list represents the result of one write operation. The size of the result list is equal to the size of the input list. Buffers are written in order, and the list of result futures has the same order.
        Parameters:
        record - set of log records
        Returns:
        A Future which contains a list of Future DLSNs if the record was successfully written or an exception if the operation fails.

      • truncate

        CompletableFuture<Boolean> truncate(DLSN dlsn)
        Truncate the log until dlsn.
        Parameters:
        dlsn - dlsn to truncate until.
        Returns:
        A Future indicates whether the operation succeeds or not, or an exception if the truncation fails.

      • markEndOfStream

        CompletableFuture<Long> markEndOfStream()
        Seal the log stream.
        Returns:
        a future indicates whether the stream is sealed or not. The final transaction id is returned if the stream is sealed, otherwise an exception is returned.

      • getStreamName

        String getStreamName()
        Get the name of the stream this writer writes data to
